result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ricky D. Schultz was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pursuant to Wis. Stat 973.05(4)(b), restitution, costs, and surcharges are to be paid from all prison funds, not to exceed 25% of gross.  Must submit a DNA sample if not already on file and must pay the surcharge.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation/extended supervision now serving

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.
Must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  You must also comply with any recommendations.

defendant.name: Schultz, Ricky D.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
From DOC
of 4/20/15 sentencing hearing.
Destroyed fingerprint card

Defendant appeared in custody in person with his counsel James Ritland.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Ritland makes note of a small discrepancy in the PSI - not all of his convictions are alcohol related as stated in the PSI.  DA states there are no victim issues and no restitution.  State recommends 3 years prison with 3 years extended supervision with conditions.  Defense prefers treatment but agrees with State's recommendation.  Court reviews charge/penalties with defendant and accepts joint recommendation.  Sentences to 3 years prison with 3 years extended supervision with following conditions:  Must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Court finds eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  Other sentence requirements:    Must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and a driver safety plan.  You must also comply with any recommendations.  Driver's license is revoked for 36 months and IID ordered for 36 months and must pay the IID surcharge.  Must also reimburse cost for blood draw bill if any.  Credit for 375 days served.
faxed to Judge Damon
Faxed Order for PSI to Judge Damon (have docs on my desk)

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel James Ritland.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Ritland withdraws his Motion to Withdraw as Counsel as the defendant now wants to continue with his representation.  DA's recommendation:  3 years prison, 3 years ES and eligible for ERP.  Civil traffic to be DRI.  Defendant pled guilty to Count 1.  Judge reviewed plea questionnaire/rights/elements with defendant.  Verified prior convictions.  Gave felony warning.  Defense stipulated to factual basis in complaint.  Court accepts plea as given knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Count 2 is dismissed.  14TR1073 and 14TR1362 are both dismissed.  Defense attorney Ritland requests a PSI and also that the defendant be allowed to go to the Tomah VA for treatment.  DA objected.  Bond is continued as is.  PDI due by 4-1-15 and sentencing set for 4-20-15 at 1:00.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances (including morphine).   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. Defendant must be equipped with SCRAM before being released. Defendant must remain at his residence at all times except for medical or legal appointments.
